title: Spain sees 56% surge in registered crypto firms in 2023
description:
Thirty companies were granted virtual asset service provider licenses in the country during the year.

The number of crypto companies officially registered to operate in Spain grew roughly 56% in 2023. According to the official registry, published as an xls document on the website of Spain’s Central Bank,  30 companies were granted a virtual asset service provider license this year. 

With little more than a week to the end of the calendar year, the 53 companies added to the registry in 2022 still look more impressive than this year’s 30 new licensees. However, that could be attributed to the fact that the registry wasn't open before 2022.

This year, the registry saw the addition of several international platforms, such as Revolut, Bitpanda, Crypto.com and Vivid. Some big names are still absent from the registry, despite the recent news about Coinbase securing an Anti-Money Laundering compliance registration and Kraken attaining a virtual asset service provider registration. Domestic companies still dominate the market, holding 61 licenses out of 85.

Read more

title: Report: Nigerian Currency Plunges to New Low Versus the US Dollar
description: The official exchange rate of the Nigerian currency versus the U.S. dollar recently plunged to a record low of 1,248 naira for every greenback. The governor of the Central Bank of Nigeria has told the country’s legislators that he sees the foreign exchange market stabilizing in 2024. Official Rate Nearly Matches the Parallel Market Rate […]

title: Elon Musk anticipates mid-2024 launch for X’s in-app payment services
description: Tech Mogul Elon Musk’s latest venture, ‘X,’ is poised to roll out in-app payment services on its social media platform around mid-2024.
